patients.name: Smith, John
patients.primary_history:
# Anaemia
- Diagnosed with iron-deficiency anaemia 2 years ago
- On oral iron supplementation
- Last FBE showed improvement
patients.clinical_history:
- Patient reports feeling more energetic
- No new symptoms
- Compliant with medications
patients.plan:
1. Continue current iron supplementation
2. Repeat FBE in 3 months
3. Follow up appointment in 4 months
patients.encounter_summary: 65-year-old male with stable iron-deficiency anaemia showing improvement on oral iron supplementation.

patients.name: Johnson, Emily
patients.primary_history:
# Thrombocytopenia
- Incidental finding 6 months ago
- Asymptomatic
- Stable platelet count
patients.clinical_history:
- No bleeding symptoms
- No new bruising
- Otherwise feeling well
patients.plan:
1. Monitor FBE every 2 months
2. Advise to report any unusual bleeding
3. Consider haematology referral if platelets drop below 80
patients.encounter_summary: 35-year-old female with stable mild thrombocytopenia, likely benign, under observation.

patients.name: Brown, Robert
patients.primary_history:
# Polycythaemia Vera
- Diagnosed 5 years ago
- On hydroxyurea
- Regular venesections
patients.clinical_history:
- Feeling well
- No thrombotic symptoms
- Tolerating hydroxyurea
patients.plan:
1. Increase hydroxyurea dose
2. Schedule venesection
3. Repeat FBE in 2 weeks
4. Emphasize importance of hydration
patients.encounter_summary: 62-year-old male with polycythaemia vera requiring adjustment in hydroxyurea dose and venesection.

patients.name: Davis, Sarah
patients.primary_history:
# Sickle Cell Trait
- Discovered during pregnancy screening
- No history of crises
patients.clinical_history:
- No sickle cell-related symptoms
- Managing anxiety well
- Recent migraine frequency increased
patients.impression: Stable sickle cell trait, worsening migraines
patients.plan:
1. Education on sickle cell trait
2. Refer to neurology for migraine management
3. Annual FBE
patients.encounter_summary: 33-year-old female with sickle cell trait and increasing migraine frequency, referred to neurology.

patients.name: Wilson, Michael
patients.primary_history:
# Chronic Lymphocytic Leukaemia
- Diagnosed 3 years ago
- Watch and wait approach
- Stable lymphocyte count
patients.clinical_history:
- Fatigue has improved
- No B symptoms
- Joint pain well-managed
patients.impression: Stable CLL, no indication for treatment
patients.plan:
1. Continue watch and wait
2. FBE and clinical review every 3 months
3. Discuss vaccinations
patients.encounter_summary: 69-year-old male with stable chronic lymphocytic leukaemia, continuing watch and wait approach.

patients.name: Taylor, Emma
patients.primary_history:
# Iron Deficiency
- Diagnosed 1 year ago
- Heavy menstrual bleeding
- On oral iron therapy
patients.clinical_history:
- Fatigue persists
- Menstrual bleeding still heavy
- Mood stable on current medication
patients.impression: Persistent iron deficiency, likely due to ongoing blood loss
patients.plan:
1. Increase iron supplementation
2. Refer to gynaecology for menorrhagia management
3. Repeat FBE in 6 weeks
patients.encounter_summary: 41-year-old female with persistent iron deficiency due to heavy menstrual bleeding, referred to gynaecology.

patients.name: Anderson, James
patients.primary_history:
# Haemophilia A
- Diagnosed in childhood
- On prophylactic factor VIII
- No recent bleeds
patients.clinical_history:
- No spontaneous bleeds
- Weight stable
- Using CPAP regularly
patients.plan:
1. Continue current factor VIII regimen
2. Annual comprehensive haemophilia review
3. Encourage weight loss strategies
patients.encounter_summary: 54-year-old male with well-controlled haemophilia A on prophylactic factor VIII.

patients.name: Martin, Olivia
patients.primary_history:
# Immune Thrombocytopenia
- Diagnosed 2 years ago
- Previous treatment with steroids
- Currently on watch and wait
patients.clinical_history:
- No bleeding symptoms
- Fatigue improved with thyroxine adjustment
- No new bruising
patients.plan:
1. Continue monitoring, no treatment needed
2. Monthly FBE for next 3 months
3. Educate on signs of bleeding to watch for
patients.encounter_summary: 29-year-old female with stable immune thrombocytopenia, adequate platelet count, under monitoring.

patients.name: Thompson, William
patients.primary_history:
# Myelodysplastic Syndrome
- Diagnosed 1 year ago
- Low-risk IPSS-R
- Transfusion dependent
patients.clinical_history:
- Increasing fatigue
- No bleeding or infectious episodes
- Stable angina symptoms
patients.plan:
1. Increase frequency of RBC transfusions
2. Start erythropoiesis-stimulating agent
3. Monitor ferritin and consider iron chelation
4. Bone marrow biopsy in 3 months
patients.encounter_summary: 76-year-old male with progressive myelodysplastic syndrome, increasing transfusion requirements, starting erythropoiesis-stimulating agent.

patients.name: White, Sophia
patients.primary_history:
# Beta Thalassemia Minor
- Diagnosed in childhood
- Asymptomatic
- Regular monitoring
patients.clinical_history:
- Mild fatigue, attributed to recent viral infection
- No new symptoms
- Planning pregnancy in near future
patients.plan:
1. Routine FBE in 6 months
2. Folic acid supplementation
3. Genetic counselling referral for pregnancy planning
patients.encounter_summary: 37-year-old female with stable beta thalassemia minor, planning pregnancy, referred for genetic counselling.

patients.name: Clark, Daniel
patients.primary_history:
# Hereditary Spherocytosis
- Diagnosed in young adulthood
- Splenectomy at age 25
- Stable haemoglobin
patients.clinical_history:
- No episodes of haemolysis
- Good energy levels
- Compliant with post-splenectomy prophylaxis
patients.plan:
1. Annual FBE and reticulocyte count
2. Ensure up-to-date with vaccinations
3. Continue penicillin prophylaxis
patients.encounter_summary: 51-year-old male with well-compensated hereditary spherocytosis post-splenectomy, on penicillin prophylaxis.

patients.name: Harris, Ava
patients.primary_history:
# Von Willebrand Disease Type 1
- Diagnosed at age 16
- Mild bleeding symptoms
- Uses tranexamic acid for heavy periods
patients.clinical_history:
- Minor gum bleeding
- Anxiety well-controlled
- Planning wisdom teeth extraction
patients.plan:
1. Advise on dental extraction management
2. Prescribe desmopressin nasal spray
3. Review in 3 months post-procedure
patients.encounter_summary: 32-year-old female with stable Von Willebrand Disease Type 1, preparing for wisdom teeth extraction.

patients.name: Young, Ethan
patients.primary_history:
# Paroxysmal Nocturnal Hemoglobinuria
- Diagnosed 3 years ago
- On eculizumab therapy
- History of thrombosis
patients.oahp:
# Deep Vein Thrombosis
# Chronic Kidney Disease Stage 2
patients.clinical_history:
- No recent haemolysis
- Stable renal function
- No new thrombotic events
patients.plan:
1. Continue eculizumab as per schedule
2. Monitor LDH and renal function monthly
3. Maintain anticoagulation
4. Bone marrow assessment in 6 months
patients.encounter_summary: 44-year-old male with paroxysmal nocturnal hemoglobinuria well-controlled on eculizumab, history of thrombosis.

patients.name: Lee, Grace
patients.primary_history:
# Essential Thrombocythemia
- JAK2 positive
- Diagnosed 4 years ago
- On hydroxyurea
patients.clinical_history:
- Stable platelet count
- No thrombotic events
- Occasional mild headaches
patients.impression: Essential thrombocythemia, good response to treatment
patients.plan:
1. Continue hydroxyurea at current dose
2. Low-dose aspirin daily
3. FBE every 4 weeks
4. Bone densitometry scan annually
patients.encounter_summary: 56-year-old female with essential thrombocythemia responding well to hydroxyurea treatment.

patients.name: Walker, Noah
patients.primary_history:
# Severe Haemophilia B
- Diagnosed in infancy
- On prophylactic factor IX
- Target joints: right knee, left ankle
patients.clinical_history:
- No spontaneous bleeds in last 6 months
- Improved mobility in target joints
- Hepatitis C successfully treated 2 years ago
patients.plan:
1. Continue prophylactic factor IX
2. Physiotherapy for target joints
3. Annual comprehensive review
4. Hepatology follow-up in 6 months
patients.encounter_summary: 25-year-old male with well-managed severe Haemophilia B on prophylactic factor IX, improved joint mobility.

patients.name: Hall, Chloe
patients.primary_history:
# Aplastic Anaemia
- Diagnosed 2 years ago
- Failed immunosuppressive therapy
- Post-allogeneic stem cell transplant 6 months ago
patients.clinical_history:
- Improving blood counts
- Mild skin GVHD
- No infections
patients.impression: Recovering aplastic anaemia post-transplant, mild GVHD
patients.plan:
1. Gradually taper immunosuppression
2. Weekly FBE for next month
3. Continue GVHD prophylaxis
4. Bone marrow biopsy at 1-year post-transplant
patients.encounter_summary: 39-year-old female recovering from aplastic anaemia post-allogeneic stem cell transplant, with mild skin GVHD.

patients.name: Lewis, Thomas
patients.primary_history:
# Multiple Myeloma
- IgG kappa
- Diagnosed 3 years ago
- Achieved VGPR with VRD induction
- On lenalidomide maintenance
patients.clinical_history:
- Stable paraprotein levels
- No new bone pain
- Fatigue improved
patients.impression: Multiple myeloma in VGPR, stable on maintenance
patients.plan:
1. Continue lenalidomide maintenance
2. Monthly paraprotein and light chains
3. Quarterly zoledronic acid infusion
4. Renal function monitoring
patients.encounter_summary: 67-year-old male with multiple myeloma in VGPR, stable on lenalidomide maintenance.

patients.name: Scott, Mia
patients.primary_history:
# Sickle Cell Disease
- HbSS genotype
- Frequent pain crises
- On hydroxyurea
patients.clinical_history:
- Reduced frequency of pain crises
- Hip pain stable
- No recent hospitalisations
patients.impression: Sickle cell disease, improved with hydroxyurea
patients.plan:
1. Continue hydroxyurea, adjust dose
2. Pain management review
3. Echocardiogram for pulmonary hypertension screening
4. Discuss need for hip replacement
patients.encounter_summary: 31-year-old female with sickle cell disease showing improved symptoms on hydroxyurea, considering hip replacement.

patients.name: Green, Liam
patients.primary_history:
# Chronic Myeloid Leukaemia
- BCR-ABL positive
- Diagnosed 5 years ago
- On second-generation TKI (nilotinib)
patients.clinical_history:
- Achieved major molecular response
- Tolerating nilotinib well
- No cardiovascular symptoms
patients.plan:
1. Continue nilotinib
2. Quarterly BCR-ABL PCR monitoring
3. Annual cardiovascular risk assessment
4. Consider TKI cessation trial in future
patients.encounter_summary: 46-year-old male with chronic myeloid leukaemia in major molecular response on nilotinib.

patients.name: Baker, Charlotte
patients.primary_history:
# Hodgkin Lymphoma
- Nodular sclerosis subtype
- Stage IIB
- Completed ABVD chemotherapy 1 year ago
patients.clinical_history:
- In complete remission
- Mild fatigue
- No B symptoms
patients.plan:
1. Surveillance CT scan
2. Thyroid function tests
3. Discuss fertility preservation options
4. Long-term follow-up for secondary malignancies
patients.encounter_summary: 35-year-old female with Hodgkin Lymphoma in remission one year post-ABVD chemotherapy, undergoing surveillance.
